intro: Inula hissarica, commonly known as the Hissar hawk’s-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features a tall, erect stem with rough, hairy leaves that are alternate and lance-shaped. Its yellow ray florets are surrounded by numerous tubular disc florets, which are typical of the genus Inula. Inula hissarica is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in temperate to cold climates.
